Utils#

Utility module providing encryption, rate limiting, and caching functionalities.

This module loads environment variables, configures logging, manages AES encryption keys, and supplies helper functions for encrypting/decrypting data, rate limiting, and caching results.

setup_logging()[source]#

Configure and return a logger instance using environment settings.

Environment Variables:

LOGGING_LEVEL (str): Logging verbosity level. Defaults to ‘INFO’.

Returns:

Configured logger instance.

Return type:

logging.Logger

get_or_generate_env_key(key_name, length, is_base64=False)[source]#

Retrieve an environment key. If not found, generate and persist a new key.

Parameters:

  • key_name (str) – The name of the environment variable.

  • length (int) – Length in bytes of the key to generate if missing.

  • is_base64 (bool, optional) – If True, key is base64 encoded; otherwise hex.

Returns:

The retrieved or generated key as a string.

Return type:

str

get_secret_key()[source]#

Retrieve Flask’s SECRET_KEY from environment or generate one if missing.

Returns:

The Flask SECRET_KEY.

Return type:

str

get_encryption_keys()[source]#

Retrieve AES encryption key and IV from environment variables.

Returns:

AES key (32 bytes) and initialization vector (16 bytes).

Return type:

Tuple[bytes, bytes]

get_env_value(key_name, default=None)[source]#

Retrieve an environment variable or return a default value.

Parameters:

  • key_name (str) – The environment variable name.

  • default (Optional[str]) – Fallback value if key is not found.

Returns:

The retrieved or default value as a string.

str

is_password_strong(password)[source]#

Validate password strength.

Criteria: - At least one uppercase letter. - At least one lowercase letter. - At least one number. - Length between 8 and 30 characters.

Parameters:

password (str) – Password to validate.

Returns:

True if password is strong, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
